movies.title: The Devil's Backbone
movies.plot: It is 1939, the end of three years of bloody civil war in Spain, and General Franco's right-wing Nationalists are poised to defeat the left-wing Republican forces. A ten-year-old boy named Carlos, the son of a fallen Republican war hero, is left by his tutor in an orphanage in the middle of nowhere. The orphanage is run by a curt but considerate headmistress named Carmen and a kindly Professor Casares, both of whom are sympathetic to the doomed Republican cause. Despite their concern for him, and his gradual triumph over the usual schoolhouse bully, Carlos never feels completely comfortable in his new environment. First of all, there was that initial encounter with the orphanage's nasty caretaker, Jacinto, who reacts even more violently when anyone is caught looking around a particular storage room the one with the deep well. Second, and more inexplicable, is the presence of a ghost, one of the former occupants of the orphanage named Santi. Not long after Carlos' arrival, Santi ...
movies.simplePlot: After Carlos - a 12-year-old whose father has died in the Spanish Civil War - arrives at an ominous boys' orphanage, he discovers the school is haunted and has many dark secrets that he must uncover.

biography.bio: Marisa Paredes was born on April 3, 1946 in Madrid, Madrid, Spain as María Luisa Paredes Bartolomé. She is an actress, known for Life Is Beautiful (1997), All About My Mother (1999) and La piel que habito (2011). She is married to Antonio Isasi-Isasmendi. They have one child.
biography.name: Marisa Paredes

biography.bio: Eduardo Noriega Gómez was born in Santander, Cantabria, Spain. The youngest of 7 siblings, he had shown a very big talent for artistic activities since he was a child. He began taking piano lessons and got into the Santander Music Conservatory, where he studied for five years. His music professors discovered that he had many conditions for playing piano, so they would keep him practicing for hours until he got tired of it and quit. After finishing high school, he decided to become a lawyer and majored at University of Santander, one of the most prestigious universities in Europe.That wouldn't last long either, because he got the acting bug by chance when attended an acting class alongside a friend that wanted to be an actress, he was invited to participate and enjoyed it enough to do that for living. At 19, he relocated to Madrid to start his drama classes at the R.E.S.A.D. (Madrid Acting Conservatory) and tried to continue with Law School attending the U.N.E.D. (a college where people can study even if they live far away), but due to the time the acting classes demanded him, couldn't focus on his other career and quit after passing the first signature. Once at the Conservatory he met Mateo Gil and Alejandro Amenábar, who was searching for good average students to make his first short films. Noriega shot a few shorts with both of them until he landed one of the starring roles in Amenábar's opera prima Thesis (1996). This movie became the most successful movie of the year in Spain and Eduardo Noriega and Fele Martínez became huge stars. In 1996, Eduardo had a tiny part in Pedro Olea's Más allá del jardín (1996) and the main role in Question of Luck (1996), shot in San Sebastián. During the making of this movie, his mother passed away and he channeled his grief into work by making Open Your Eyes (1997), another Amenábar's movie that became one of the suspense classics worldwide. This part gave Noriega his first Goya Award nomination, but he lost to Fernando Fernán Gómez, although he was consecrated as a very promising actor. Soon after, he tried himself in comedy by taking part in the movie Cha-cha-chá (1998) where he showed his skills as a comedian and met who would be his girlfriend for two years: Ana Alvarez. The relationship ended in good terms and afterward, he arrived to Argentina to make another movie that would become a cult one: Burnt Money (2000). This flick won the Goya Award in 2001 and Eduardo met his now friend Leonardo Sbaraglia. Between 2001 and 2004, he made movies in France, Madagascar and Spain. 2004 was the year that gave him the chance to play a real life character for first time in the movie El Lobo (2004). He played Txema, an insider infiltrated in ETA who gave information to the government to dismantle the terrorist group. Critics and people loved his interpretation and earned him a second Goya nomination. Next year, he had the chance to play another controversial character: Che Guevara, becoming the first Spanish actor to play it. In 2006 Master Kowalski (2006) was released at the same time that the theater play and became a blockbuster in Spain and Argentina, Marcelo Piñeyro was the director and also had directed Burnt Money (2000). His most challenging role was yet to come, nevertheless: Vicente Aranda was preparing to direct Lolita's Club (2007)and also looking for an actor who dared play twins who where identical in the outside but totally different inside, because one was a violent smart cop and the other one a mentally retarded sweet man. On December 3, 2007 he won the GQ award as the "Actor of the Year". In 2008 he participated in two American movies: Vantage Point (2008) and Transsiberian (2008). In 2009 he re-teamed with Amenábar (this time as a producer, not director) in Le pacte du mal (2010), where he had to look older to play an apparently cold-blooded doctor that used to deal with terminal patients, but his life is stricken when his teenage daughter becomes his patient. With this movie, Eduardo showed his maturity as an actor and next year he could fulfill a dream: making a western. Blackthorn (2011) told the story of Butch Cassidy in exile while staying in Bolivia. Sam Shepard and Stephen Rea were part of this superb cast as well. During the half of 2011 a new suspense TV series called Homicidios (2011) began to be promoted on channel Tele5. This thriller meant the return of Eduardo Noriega to television (he had only had a small part in the 1994-1996 show "Colegio Mayor"). "Homicidios" premiered on 20 September 2011 in prime-time with a very high rating. Although it was switched to different times until even midnight, it had the highest audience of his all time branches. In 2013 he will release the movie The Last Stand, alongside Arnold Schwarzenegger.
biography.name: Eduardo Noriega

biography.bio: Federico Luppi was born on February 23, 1936 in Ramallo, Buenos Aires, Argentina. He is an actor and director, known for Pan's Labyrinth (2006), Cronos (1993) and The Devil's Backbone (2001). He has been married to Susana Hornos since January 24, 2003.
biography.name: Federico Luppi

biography.bio: Fernando Tielve was born on July 21, 1986 in Madrid, Spain. He is an actor, known for Pan's Labyrinth (2006), The Devil's Backbone (2001) and Goya's Ghosts (2006).
biography.name: Fernando Tielve

biography.bio: Inigo Fernandito Marcos Garces was born in Madrid, Spain, on December 31th, 1987. He was the first child who born to Sandros and Paula Garces. At the age of 6, Inigo auditioned for a milk commercial accompanied by his father and started his acting career. His first appearance was as the role of George in famous USA TV Series "The X-Files" and then he appeared in other some TV series, such as "Joey", "Angel", "Jesse" and "Touched by an Angel." When he was 9, he moved to Spain and auditioned for "Secretos del Corazon" and made his first debut in big screen, as Carlos. Following the success of this movie, Inigo starred in another Spanish movie critical acclaim, "La Primera Noche de mi vida", who make him won Spanish Malaga Film Festival, also starred with Javier Bardem in "Los Lobos de Washington", and Guilermo Del Toro's critical acclaim "El Espinazo del Diablo." His last movie is "Stronger" (2004), and since then he stopped acting for finish his college.
biography.name: Íñigo Garcés

biography.bio: Irene Visedo was born on July 16, 1978 in Madrid, Spain as Irene Visedo Herrero. She is an actress, known for Cuéntame (2001), The Devil's Backbone (2001) and The Lost Steps (2001).
biography.name: Irene Visedo

biography.bio: José Manuel Lorenzo was born in Pontevedra, Pontevedra, Galicia, Spain. He is a producer and writer, known for Don't Tempt Me (2001), Walking Vengeance (2008) and Crossing Borders (2006).
biography.name: José Manuel Lorenzo

biography.bio: Francisco Maestre was born on July 2, 1957 in Mérida, Badajoz, Extremadura, Spain as Francisco Maestre Soriano. He was an actor, known for Bad Education (2004), The Devil's Backbone (2001) and Love in Difficult Times (2005). He died on January 27, 2011 in Pozuelo de Alarcón, Madrid, Spain.
biography.name: Francisco Maestre

biography.bio: Junio Valverde was born on May 28, 1990 in Madrid, Spain as Junio Valverde Gimeno. He is an actor and director, known for The Devil's Backbone (2001), Frisson (2008) and Vida y color (2005).
biography.name: Junio Valverde

biography.bio: Berta Ojea was born in Galicia, Spain as Berta Ojea López. She is an actress, known for The Devil's Backbone (2001), Les femmes du 6e étage (2010) and The Sleeping Voice (2011).
biography.name: Berta Ojea

biography.bio: Adrián Lamana was born on January 16, 1990 in Barcelona, Catalonia, Spain. He is an actor, known for The Devil's Backbone (2001), Yo soy Bea (2006) and Ali (2012).
biography.name: Adrián Lamana

biography.bio: Daniel Esparza was born on February 18, 1987 in Madrid, Spain. He is an actor, known for The Devil's Backbone (2001), La famille Serrano (2003) and Compañeros (1998).
biography.name: Daniel Esparza

biography.bio: Miguel Ortiz was born in 1963 in Madrid, Madrid, Spain. He is an actor and director, known for El súper (1996), The Devil's Backbone (2001) and Love in Difficult Times (2005).
biography.name: Miguel Ortiz

biography.bio: Juan Carlos Vellido was born on March 18, 1968 in Barcelona, Barcelona, Catalonia, Spain. He is an actor and producer, known for Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides (2011), Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales (2017) and 18 Meals (2010).
biography.name: Juan Carlos Vellido

biography.bio: Javier Bódalo was born on June 24, 1992 in Madrid, Madrid, Spain. He is an actor, known for The Devil's Backbone (2001), Ghost Graduation (2012) and The Night of the Virgin (2016).
biography.name: Javier Bódalo
